instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U6100: What is U6100? this is an SPI ROM chip that holds the BIOS which is necessary for the machine to POST or try and power on..
definitions.PLT_RST: What is PLT_RST?  PLT_RST stands for platform reset. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not show image.
threads.message: I've already released 3 macbook air without solution, because it doesn't give video, I clean the ME region, I see all the components around the <CHIP>U6100</CHIP>, <SIGNAL>PLT_RST</SIGNAL> high, ALL SYS high, Vcore high, all that's left is the fucking mac to turn on, but it has video, I'm outraged. Please tell me which component is causing this, for the love of God ? is the PCH, SMC, CPU, controllers ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not show image.
threads.message: Do you get USB activity at least???

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not show image.
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> does not show image.
threads.message:
Then why this fix about image???

In case like this, clean ME region of original BIOS doesn't help.
You must try FULL known good BIOS.
